Posts.Content: Hello just to say that I waited 8 weeks for surgery after chemo. Then after that another 8 weeks for radiotherapy.  Just had my first clear scan if that makes you any calmer. I know I did panic about the gap but was assured it was fine. I had all my lymph nodes out as had spread but feel very positive. Hope that helps.
Posts.Title: Gap between chemo and surgery and radiation

Posts.Content: Thank you Jess I will do. Good idea.
Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: Hello, what brings me to this site after a year of treatment? Something rather trivial actually but not to me. Does anyone know of a good place to buy a one strapped rucksack with good waist support so that I can still do some long distance walking routes if I feel so inclined in the future? Not sure anyone has so far asked this question! I had all my lymph nodes removed (21 I am told) and want to avoid aggravating any lymphedema issues but don't want breast cancer to stop me in my tracks!
Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: Hi Fiddlesticks,  Fantastic that you went out for a walk and used your bum bag. Great idea. Good for you!! When I find a good rucksack though for the longer walks I will definitely let you know. Not great at sorting this website yet so not sure how to add you to my favourites so that I can find you when I find the right rucksack. But I will!!! A x

Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: Hello fiddlesticks,  Thank you for your response. Yes I will let you know what I find. I am looking for a good day pack so that I too can carry everything and not rely on partner and others! Ideally one with good support around the waist which takes most of the load anyway. I have been out walking with just the one strap on normal rucksacks, not a good look and all lop sided! x
Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: Hello Lucy,  Yes I was told I had mild lymphedema and it was a bit of a shock, another thing to deal with. I have done lots of long distance walking and lovely day walks and am keen to carry on and not let this thing stop me doing the things I love. I am a relatively fit 50 year old but whatever age I get to I want the choice! I will let you know when I find one that is decent when I have done my research, purchased and tested! Get out to those beautiful hills of yours even for half an hour and cheat by getting to the highest point you can by car!! i took my mum (83) up to near Hay Bluff in the Black Mountains and sat her some 200 metres from the car but a spectacular view with no effort but so good for the soul. She loved the feeling of just being there. Alison x
Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: Hello foxy sash, Thank you for responding. I guess there are many side effects to all these drugs, some we are aware of and others we are not (which is more scary). I honestly don't think about it too often but the taste in my mouth is  definitely there and noticeable at times. Hey ho! Sorry to hear you are suffering and I hope your doctor can give you some good advice. Not enjoying a cup of tea is the pits! Can I just ask whilst you are there, how long do you have to be on Anastrozole for, is it 5 or 10 years?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - 1 year on

Posts.Content: Hello,  I just wanted to know if anyone else has a funny taste in their mouth and the occasional tingly teeth from Tamoxifen. It is mild but slightly annoying.Otherwise I don't seem to have too many side effects (cross fingers) other than stiff joints first thing in the morning which goes once I get moving. One year on and getting on with my life and appreciating it even more! windinsails x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - 1 year on

Posts.Content: Hi,  It goes on a bit doesn't it!!! I am only one year in so mustn't look too far ahead, but I seem to be the other way round from you, Tamoxifen and then another, I guess when I get post menopausal. I was just thinking in my head that after 5 years on Tamoxifen or whatever I might go back to oncologist and get my profile stats run through the machine to see if worth taking for 10 rather than 5 years. Anyway side effects not too bad at the moment. Good luck in your journey . We are certainly not alone!!!
